name: French in a Flash: Green Salad with Creamy Goat Cheese Dressing
description: With the chèvre poured over torn green leaf lettuce and topped with garden tomatoes, snipped chives, and toasted walnuts, the salad has a definite bistro feel, but it's easy to make, light but decadent, and a bit off the beaten track
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 ounces fresh goat cheese, room temperature
10 cups roughly chopped greenleaf lettuce (about 2 small heads)

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the goat cheese, mayonnaise, half and half, and vinegar until mostly smooth. Season to taste with salt and a lot of black pepper.
Toss the lettuce lightly with the dressing. Save whatever is leftover in a closed container in the refrigerator. Top the salad with tomato wedges, chives, and walnuts. Serve immediately.
